item.title: Multiple SSH keys setup for git
item.description: I always configure git to use SSH for connection. And I don’t share private keys among instances. I belive this is the best practice. As a contractor, I need to perform my work duties on my personal equipment from time to time. Organisations quite often hosts its repositories on github.com. GitHub in its official docs encourage users to use the same personal account for both private use and when working for an organisation.

item.title: Git cheatsheet
item.description: Intro Link to heading During the years of experience with git I have noted aside many commands which could be useful. In this short article I present the most frequently used git commands and configuration steps I always follow in a new work environment. Configuration Link to heading User information $ git config --global user.name "Weselak, Pawel" $ git config --global user.email "nospam@pawelweselak.com" SSH keys $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "nospam@pawelweselak.
